title.rendered: Minecraft explained for parents ♥ Let your child play!

content.rendered:
Are you looking for someone to explain Minecraft to you because your child really wants to play it? Admittedly, I’m a little late, because Minecraft has been around since 2011. Now some readers have asked for an article about Minecraft from a parent’s perspective. I started Minecraft back in 2011. Today both my 7 year old and my 11 year old son play Minecraft regularly. So who better to write about it? My son created the following text, which I just commented on with “Parents’ perspective”. Leave him a comment!

Why Minecraft is the perfect game for kids

What is Minecraft? Minecraft is a Open world game in which there is no prescribed goal. You can explore the world of Minecraft and plunge into exciting adventures. There is a lot to explore, such as different dungeons or normal caves where you can find ores and other valuable resources for later gameplay (gaming experience) and mine them with a pickaxe. There are also different dungeons like the Nether (like hell) or the end.

Minecraft explained to parents – from the child!

You decide for yourself which way you want to go. Do you want to build the most beautiful castle? Do you want to explore caves or meet the villagers? Are you interested in making the coolest things with the found materials? Minecraft gives you the choice! Both children and adults can let off steam creatively in Minecraft.

Minecraft explained: How to play

About the gameplay: You start in a world with different biomes (ice and snow biomes, grass and meadow biomes, mountains, forests, jungles, swamps and many more).

You can craft different tools for different activities that will make playing easier for you. Minecraft is a very realistic game except for the fact that all textures are square. There is no blood when you kill animals or monsters to get raw materials for various recipes. The opponent then only lights up red once and disappears in a kind of fog when he has been fought.

The boys play Minecraft together on the Switch.

Different game modes in Minecraft

There are different game modes like survival mode, adventure and creative mode. In which survival mode you fight for survival by killing monsters and crafting important tools. But watch out, the monsters come at night, build your dwelling before nightfall!

in the creative mode you can let your creativity run free and express your thoughts with buildings. In Minecraft Creative Mode, no one tells you what to do and what not to do, you decide.

But there is another game mode, namely the adventure mode. In this mode you can look at buildings but not destroy them.

First computer game: Minecraft – explained for parents

Difficulty level: Prefer to live dangerously?

There are four different difficulty levels: peaceful, easy, normal and hard.

  • Peaceful: No monsters are generated, you don’t lose hunger clubs, and you continuously regenerate life. Perfect for younger kids!
  • Easy: Monsters are generated, Creepers (green exploding monsters) stop their explosion even if you move a few blocks away, enemies deal much less damage.
  • normal: Monsters are generated, you lose Hunger Clubs, and you can only regenerate life by eating something. You can only eat when you are hungry.
  • Difficult: Monsters are generated, enemies deal significantly more damage than in the other difficulties, and they drop fewer items. Also, zombies can break down doors and there is a chance if you use a throwing potion that a spider will spawn.

Age recommendation for Minecraft

From what age is Minecraft suitable? Minecraft is approved by the entertainment software self-control (USK) from six years. It also depends on which mode you play. While Creative and Adventure modes are relatively harmless, Survival and Hardcore modes are more offensive and attack-oriented.

The little son can watch his brother play Minecraft

Frequently asked questions about Minecraft from parents

parent view: Honestly, as a mom, I grew into Minecraft. I played the game with my husband when it was still a newcomer to the gaming market. So I never questioned whether it was educationally valuable.

You can imagine Minecraft like Lego in the digital world. You can either just build or engage in battles with your character. This is what makes Minecraft magic. At the beginning we set our then 6-year-old son that he could only play Minecraft peacefully. Then there are no scary moments in the game. Our son has now been playing Minecraft for over 6 years and obviously knows a lot more than we parents do!

Is Minecraft Educational?

As weird as it sounds, Minecraft can actually be educational for kids. You can exercise creativity and use the so-called “Redstone” to build real, complex, mechanical works of art, such as a working computer.

How much does Minecraft cost?

Minecraft Cost: The Minecraft Java Edition costs €23.95. The price of the Bedrock Edition is between 20-30 € on the different platforms.

Is there an in game store?

Yes, there is an in-game store. Here you can buy cosmetic items such as wings, headdresses, pets or even worlds in which you can play. The currency is called “Minecoins”, which you can buy from there, on the Internet, in the game launcher (program interface), or in the Nintendo or Playstation Store.

What platforms is Minecraft available on?

Minecraft, as it is one of the most well-known, if not the most well-known, of all games, exists on almost every platform. Minecraft is available for smartphones, Nintendo Switch, PC, Playstation and Xbox.

Which versions are there?

There are different versions of Minecraft that you can choose from. I personally play the 1.18.1 version as it can use many different items to build and survive. There are still updates for Minecraft!

Minecraft online game: Can you chat?

There is an in-game chat for communication. Games can meet for this on numerous online servers. The chat can too hidden will. Then, however, no more messages from the server are displayed. It is better to allow commands “Show commands only“. Because it makes Minecraft really powerful! More info: Chat in Minecraft.

That’s why Minecraft is great for kids

That’s another positive point about Minecraft, the variety that you can experience in the game. There are different locations, biomes, dungeons, textures, all kinds of creatures, not to mention the items. You can combine many items to create unique results. Of course there are many other good versions, actually all Minecraft versions are good versions, each one is special in its own way ;).

Build Minecraft – is like Lego in a computer game!

Finding Minecraft servers – for older kids

parent view: My son wasn’t allowed to play on a server when he was very young. Since he has known YouTubers, he has of course also looked at featured Minecraft servers here. These can have different game modes. In Bedwars e.g. B. dismantled a bed and then wiped out the opponent. It’s far too exciting for very young children, even if no blood is spilled. Of course, it always depends on the child himself.

How do I find a suitable Minecraft server?

Minecraft servers and how to find them: You can play Minecraft on servers together with other players. There are thousands of servers in Minecraft, but which are the safest and largest?

My 3 top Minecraft servers are an English server of the “hypixel“Servers of”GommeHD“ Server a good server created by a German YouTubers, and the “PurpleOre“ Server, also an English server. All servers have an in-game server that is 100% secure. You can play all sorts of things on the Hypixel server, such as Sky Wars or Bed Wars.

Explore the Minecraft world – the perfect game for elementary school children

Minecraft server with creative mode

Or simply let your imagination run wild in creative mode. On the GommeHd server you can also do many different ones minigames play games similar to those of the English Hypixel server.

On the PurpleOre You can either manage your server in survival mode fight for survival or you build in creative mode on your own plot. This is a lot that is 51×51 blocks in size. There you create works of art and buildings that you can invite your fellow players to look at.

Minecraft mods for kids

How Minecraft gets even better: Mods

Mods and how/where to install them: In Minecraft there are mods (modifications) that can affect the gaming experience and also make it easier or more difficult. A good source for this is the Curseforge website where you can install many different mods and shaders. Shaders beautify the game.

The mods allow you to play Minecraft until the end of your life. These are free and expand the game infinitely. There is new game content, modes or even a beautified design. Just look at the download count of each mod to find the best!

PS Another blog post by my son:

In Minecraft you can build dream houses and explore worlds

Conclusion: Minecraft explained for parents

I’m sure my son was certainly able to introduce you to Minecraft! I can only recommend trying Minecraft for yourself and then playing in a world together with your child. You can also create a server locally – on your computer. So there is no contact with the outside world and you are well informed about what your child loves about Minecraft.

And if you’re not a gambler yourself, that’s no problem either. Just watch a Let’s Play video together. These are gameplay footage from Minecraft players that puts you right in the middle of the action.

The player and YouTuber is definitely known throughout Germany gronk. Your child certainly knows!

Do you still have questions about Minecraft?

Feel free to comment below. My son is looking forward to feedback on his second blog post here on Mamaskind. As a Minecraft pro, I’m sure he can answer anything. 😊
